09:22 <cjd> that's the server/user id, typical of ircd ratbox when it's handling a nick collision  
09:22 <cjd> it's the id in hex, hence all of the AAA

09:26 <vmassol> will write some scripts

09:29 <vmassol> hmm I'm reading the code and there cannot be more than one bot…  
09:32 <vmassol> indeed just checked and there's a single instance of DefaultWikiIRCBotManager which is normal since it's a singleton  
09:34 <vmassol> and the ircbot instanc it contains has a nick of xwikibot  
09:35 <vmassol> checking something else

09:36 <cjd> solve 2 problems at once  
09:37 <vmassol> it's not dzad  
09:37 <vmassol> not fully

09:38 <vmassol> hmm can't even access javamelody

10:52 <vmassol> nooooo  
10:52 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> hello i am new here, i want to contribute and solve bugs form where can i start (i mean install development version and then contributing)?  
10:56 <vmassol> hi xwikiorg\_guest\_2: gsoc?  
10:57 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> yes  
10:58 <vmassol> have you fully read http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/ (there are some instructions and help there)?  
10:58 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> yes i have gone through projects and i am very much interested in two of them  
10:59 <vmassol> no I mean it explains what you could do to get selected and increaase your chances  
10:59 <vmassol> it points to http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Guidelines  
10:59 <vmassol> and it has links answering your question  
11:00 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> yes  
11:01 <vmassol> basically for the majority of projects you just need to download xwiki to have a dev environment  
11:01 <vmassol> download and install xwiki  
11:01 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> okay by installing it and i can customize the code locally  
11:02 <vmassol> xwiki has the ability to write code in wiki pages yes  
11:02 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> okay  
11:02 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> and is it too late to start from now?  
11:03 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> i am sorry to ask this que. but i really want to know  
11:07 <evalica> it's not late and you should give it a try  
11:08 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> ya sure i will try, Thanks a lot :)

13:01 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <mflorea> tmortagne: I have a 8.0-SNAPSHOT (jetty+hsqldb) and it seems that the main wiki descriptor is missing. Is this normal?  
13:49 <mflorea> I have only the main wiki  
13:50 <vmassol> sorry for the spam  
13:50 <vmassol> I'm done  
13:51 <tmortagne> mflorea: the descriptor is generated in a MandatoryDocumentInitializer so not having it is not normal no  
13:51 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has quit  
13:52 <tmortagne> I don't understand what you mean by " I have only the main wiki"  
13:54 <mflorea> I mean that I haven't created any subwiki yet  
13:54 <tmortagne> ok  
13:54 <tmortagne> even with only the main wiki it should be there, I will try to reproduce  
13:54 <tmortagne> hmm actually I think I found why in the code  
13:56 <mflorea> my problem is that $services.wiki.getById($xcontext.mainWikiName).prettyName is NULL, and this affects the document tree: the wiki node corresponding to the main wiki has no label  
13:58 <tmortagne> should be better now  
13:59 <mflorea> cool, thanks!  
13:59 <tmortagne> now pretty name migth not be set  
13:59 <tmortagne> was the case before too  
13:59 <tmortagne> should probably bulletproof this code a bit  
14:00 <tmortagne> XWikiServerXwikiDocumentInitializer make sure there is a descriptor but if there is a descriptor with no pretty name it won't touch it  
14:00 <mflorea> it worked before for sure, the pretty name was "Home"  
14:01 <mflorea> e.g. the Wikis facet from Solr search was displaying Home and not xwiki  
14:02 <tmortagne> mflorea: in the XE flavor by default the pretty name was set to "Home" yes, but technically nothing is forcing any descriptor to have pretty name field set  
14:02 <mflorea> on my side the tree could fallback on the wiki home page title if the pretty name is not set  
14:02 <mflorea> ok, then I should bulletproof the tree also  
14:02 <tmortagne> I did not say it wasn't set by default before, just that it might not be set :)  
14:03 <tmortagne> (same issue than pages titles basically)  
14:03 <tmortagne> mflorea: might be better to introduce some API to get "wiki display name" and use this API  
14:03 <tmortagne> like we have the API to get display title  
14:03 <mflorea> indeed  
14:04 <tmortagne> then this API is dealing with pretty name not existing, etc  
14:13 <ClemensR> has quit  
14:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: LDAP seems ok on 6.4.x by the way  
14:20 <tmortagne> very weird, checkstyle upgrade impacted jacoco coverage for some reason  
14:21 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok thanks, will check ci test status in a few minutes  
14:28 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <msmeria> has quit  
15:10 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:22 <Denis> has quit  
15:26 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
15:28 <vmassol> hmmm we have a dilemma  
15:28 <vmassol> if you go to an extension on e.x.o, for example http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XCarousel/  
15:28 <vmassol> the breadcrumb shows (Home icon) > Extensions > Extensions > XCarousel  
15:28 <vmassol> the first Extensions is actually the wiki name  
15:29 <vmassol> and the second Extensions is the title of the Repository app home page  
15:29 <Denis> I got plenty of error why trying to upgrading my UI from 8.0m2 to 8.0rc1  
15:29 <Denis> Got this: We couldn't find any extension with id 'org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki' and version '8.0-rc-1'. Make sure you have the right extension repositories configured.  
15:29 <Denis> Got this: Invalid answer [404] from the server when requesting [http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/rest/repository/extensions/org.xwiki.platform%3Axwiki-platform-attachment-ui/versions/8.0-rc-1]  
15:29 <vmassol> I've temporarily updated it to "Extension List" on e.x.o and I was about to make the change to the repo app  
15:29 <vmassol> but I'm not sure  
15:29 <vmassol> if you were to install the repo app in your wiki, "Extensions" would be a good title  
15:30 <vmassol> tmortagne, evalica: any idea?  
15:30 <vmassol> Denis: I think exo returns only final versions  
15:31 <Denis> so you mean, no way to execute DW between M2 and RC1 ?  
15:31 <tmortagne> exo is not the only place where there is extension  
15:31 <tmortagne> it should find what you are searching for on nexus  
15:32 <Denis> well, all I have done is deploy with the generic jar installer, and put back my data folder from m2  
15:32 <Denis> is that wrong ?  
15:33 <Denis> (done so because installer is misleading, and while it say you can update, it does not)  
15:33 <tmortagne> no idea, ever used that installer. All I can say is that if EM does not find this extension it means it has an issue with nexus  
15:33 <tmortagne> no custom configuration that would make nexus not listed anymore ?  
15:33 <tmortagne> s/ever/never/  
15:33 <Denis> nothing special, just run the installer, not install data, and copy it back from l2  
15:34 <Denis> m2  
15:34 <vmassol> I think we should display the subwiki in a special way and not like a space name  
15:34 <vmassol> I'll open a jira  
15:34 <Denis> I have to go now, but you may want to check if there is nothing wrong with nexus  
15:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: in the meantime you could maybe put something explicit like "Extensions Wiki" ?  
15:35 <Denis> I tried several time, the error is varying  
15:35 <vmassol> you mean rename the wiki in the desriptor?  
15:35 <vmassol> \*descriptor  
15:35 <tmortagne> Denis: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-attachment-ui/8.0-rc-1/ seems ok  
15:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes  
15:36 <tmortagne> that way you would have "Home > Extensions Wiki > Extensions > XCarousel"  
15:37 <evalica> vmassol: if I were to install the Repository application , I think Repository would be a good title. But this doesn't help you on e.x.o  
15:37 <tmortagne> but yes would be nice to visually see the difference between a space and a wiki in the breadcrumb  
15:37 <Denis> tried once more, and got: Invalid answer [404] from the server when requesting [http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/rest/repository/extensions/org.xwiki.platform%3Axwiki-platform-extension-ui/versions/8.0-rc-1]  
15:37 <evalica> "Extensions Wiki" will break the consistency will all the other wikis: development, commons, etc.  
15:37 <tmortagne> Denis: it's normal you get 404 on exo since it doe snot exist on exo  
15:37 <Denis> there is definitely some issue, I will try again from another network tomorrow, but this is weird  
15:37 <vmassol> created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13200  
15:37 <tmortagne> you get this error because that's the last repository it tried  
15:38 <tmortagne> you can enable debug log to get the error for each repository  
15:38 <Denis> again, nothing special in my config  
15:38 <Denis> sorry, I have to go, I will tomorrow if I reproduce again  
15:39 <Denis> nothing in the log currently, but not debug of course  
15:39 <Denis> have a nice we  
15:40 <vmassol> you too Denis!  
15:41 <Denis> has quit  
16:09 <vmassol> haha we have a bug for NS in the release plans app

16:13 <vmassol> the new copy changed the page name  
16:14 <vmassol> that's a pain

16:17 <vmassol> kill job on agent1  
16:17 <vmassol> \*killing

17:14 <vmassol> tmortagne: I got a gpg key asked after platform  
17:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: you did not get any aftre commons and rendering but you did after platform ?  
17:15 <vmassol> I got it twice initially  
17:15 <tmortagne> that's normal yes  
17:15 <vmassol> and then after plarform and before enterprise  
17:15 <tmortagne> does not make much sense to me  
17:15 <tmortagne> what was it asked for ?  
17:16 <tmortagne> maybe the gpg agent forget it after some time  
17:16 <tmortagne> mflorea did not get it once after the two at init  
17:16 <vmassol> it for "\* Creating GPG-signed tag"  
17:16 <vmassol> \*it was  
17:16 <vmassol> yes maybe it's forgotten  
17:17 <tmortagne> "after plarform and before enterprise" that's only one, right ?  
17:17 <vmassol> yes only one  
17:17 <tmortagne> ok then maybe the gpg agent timeout is too low  
17:17 <tmortagne> not sure how to configure it  
17:17 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
17:17 <tmortagne> could you create a jira issue about it ?  
17:17 <vmassol> yes ok

17:35 <slestak> has joined #xwiki  
17:38 <slestak> hey guys.  considering xwiki for an intranet.  would be deploying on windows.  
17:39 <slestak> saw the recent voting regardign default jre moveing from 7 to 8  
17:39 <slestak> java7 is not available from oracle any more (that i could find).  
17:40 <avisser> I dl'ed java 7 last week  
17:40 <slestak> let me go back and look, i thought i looked pretty closely  
17:41 <vmassol> it's still avail it's just that it's not supported any more probably  
17:41 <vmassol> http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk7-downloads-1880260.html  
17:41 <ClemensR> it is somewhere, but with a red box "unsupported since 2015" or so  
17:41 <vmassol> (first google entry :))  
17:41 <slestak> dangit, wth couldnt i see this 2 days ago  
17:41 <slestak> grr  
17:41 <vmassol> hehe  
17:42 <ClemensR> java8 is quite a bit faster, too, yet anther reason to upgrade  
17:42 <ClemensR> and even the "oldstable" xwiki 6.x runs fine with it  
17:45 <slestak> if 8 is already installed, it should work?  
17:45 <slestak> prereq says "7 or greater"  
17:47 <vmassol> yes  
17:48 <slestak> the installer says java 1.7 is required  
17:48 <vmassol> it doesn't work with 8?  
17:48 <slestak> at least the installer fro 8rc1  
17:48 <slestak> lolm that is what i asked =)  
17:48 <vmassol> can you run it?  
17:48 <vmassol> ok so
